column1: back of a length at off stump, slight shape in, punched on the up to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, swings in, hits the inside half of his angled bat as he prods at this without feet. Rolls to mid-on...where Rashid misfields and gives away a second
back of a length outside off, no movement this time, and sits up nicely. He throws his hands at this away from the body, hits through the line and gets it past cover point
back of a length outside off, no movement again, thick outside edge as he hits away from the body again, third man cleans up
back of a length at off stump, angled across him, but no movement in the air. Defended solidly off the back foot
and he picks that gap. Similar ball, back of a length, angled across the left hander. He's behind the line and opens the face last minute to run it through where slip was the previous ball
back of a length outside off, pushed into the off side on the up
good length, angled in at off stump. Big gap between bat and pad as he thumps this drive on the up, straight to mid-on on the bounce
back of a length outside off stump, uses his wrists to guide this to third man
poor ball. Offcutter, dropped short on the pads. He stands his ground, gets his bat under this and whips it over the deep square leg fielder
back of a length at off stump, dropped into the off side with soft hands
full at middle stump, pushed to mid-on off the front foot
back of a length at off stump, punched to mid-on on the up
back of a length at off stump, defended to point off the back foot

dropped short at leg stump, looks to pull, but too late on this one. The six last over was a slower ball, this one rises slightly as he gets in position. Gets a top edge but it flies well over short fine
short ball at leg stump, controlled pull shot, straight to deep square
back of a length at off stump, defended to point off the back foot with soft hands
glorious shot. Another short ball, this one at the hips. He swivels in his crease and taps the ball on the head, gets it wide of short fine and racing into the long leg boundary
good length, angled across middle stump. Goes for the reverse sweep, misses, takes it on the back leg
goes for the conventional sweep this time, misses again. Loud appeal, but that pitched outside. Rolls to short third man's left off the back thigh
good length at middle stump, defended into the off side off the front foot
good length, angled in at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler on the up
good length at middle stump, tapped into the leg side off the back foot
overpitched outside off stump, drilled straight to mid-off

good adjustment. This was short and wide, and it gripped in the pitch. He had shaped up for a cut shot and had to adjust for the pace. Did it nicely, rolled the wrists over it and slapped it past extra cover
overpitched, just outside off stump. Keeps the front leg away from the pitch and uses the room to lift this over mid-off
offcutter, sliding in at leg stump at a good length, tucked to short fine's right

oh this is close. Smith is trapped on the back foot. This skids in off a length and pings his back leg. You can see all three stumps as he's struck on the pad, but the umpire has turned down the appeal. Probably on the angle.
overpitched at middle stump, no feet, but it's in his zone. Brings the axe down on it, gets it past mid-on
back of a length, wide outside off stump. Pushed on the up into the off side
floaty, drifty ball, full at off stump. Mistimes the sweep shot and drags it to deep midwicket along the floor
full at leg stump, driven down the ground, finds long-on
good length at middle stump, whipped on the up to deep midwicket
good length at middle stump, gets down on one knee quickly, and this time he connects on the slog sweep. Lifts it over the square leg boundary
great shot. Nabi sticks to the pattern, bowls it full at off stump after a sweep attempt. This time he offers the full face and drives it to mid-off's right
goes for the sweep again. Gets a slight inside edge, onto pad

beaten for pace, but he survives. He leans in at this leg stump ball, looks to flick it after picking line early, but that's a slower ball. He chips it with no control, gets it wide of the bowler and to long-on
back of a length at middle stump, tapped on the up to long-on
beaten on pace once more. This is back of a length and Kishan wants to pull. Through the shot early and this goes over the middle stump, very nearly taking it
back of a length, this is quicker, and also beats him on pace. He's late on the pull and drags it off the sticker region, wide of long-on. They return for the second...just about, in Smith's case
and he miscues yet another pull. This is angled in at leg stump, back of a length. Closes the face too early, gets it off the top edge, but to deep square's left and into the boundary padding
slower ball, good length, down the leg side

if this pattern holds, Kishan will never pull a muscle in his life. Back of a length, slower ball, rises up on him and he misses the pull shot once more. This thuds into his back thigh and falls into the off side
good length, skids in at him from outside off stump. Hurries him on the pull shot, he gets it into the pitch and Nabi stretches to his left to stop a single
back of a length at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length, angled into the pads, flicked to short fine leg
good length at leg stump, pushed to deep midwicket
good length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler off the back foot
good length at off stump, gets the front leg across to try and flick into the leg side, forced to defend with the angle to extra cover

guess what? Miscued pull. Six. This is a googly, dropped short at middle stump. Skids through fast and he gets one hands off the bat as he hacks across the line unceremoniously. It goes high, towards the deep midwicket boundary where Nabi jumps backwards and can't catch it. Might have misjudged that, because he has no business being in from the boundary on a small ground. Kishan's first IPL fifty has come up.
back of a length at middle stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
defends this slider off the back foot, wanted to pull
dropped short at middle stump, gets in position quickly and he slaps this in front of square. Gets it over the midwicket boundary as well
goes full and flat in response, bowls it down leg side, paddles this past short fine
good length at middle stump, scythes through the line, doesn't connect once more but this goes to long-on
offcutter, short and wide, sits up for Smith who spanks this past extra cover and there's no stopping boundaries on this ground
back of a length at off stump, opens the face and slices this to sweeper cover's left to bring up the hundred stand
send your thoughts and prayers. For the bowlers. Good length outside off stump, pokes at it, gets an outside edge through second slip
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to deep midwicket on the up
full at middle stump, mistimed drive to extra cover
dropped short outside off stump, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover to bring up his fifty as well
atrocious shot. Goes for the switch hit, gets the technique all wrong and has barely even turned as this full ball misses off stump by a couple of inches
good length at off stump, goes for the sweep, top edge to deep square leg
full slider at off stump, gets down quickly and hammers this to long-on's right with a sweep
slider, good length at middle stump, and finally a batting error brings a wicket. Goes for the pull when he should've been forward. Caught dead in front of middle stump on his back leg
back of a length at off stump, punched into the pitch, across the line off the back foot. Rashid gets his hands up and stops this high to his left
offcutter, good length at off stump, thumped on the up to sweeper cover...where Shikhar Dhawan lets it go through his legs. Poor technique, despite the bad bounce last moment
good length, angled across off stump, gives the charge and misses it as he slashes
good length outside off stump, under-edges the slash, straight to extra cover
good length at middle stump, tapped on the up to long-on
back of a length outside off, slashes at this, but the reach isn't too big for Kishan. Gets it off the toe-end. straight to extra cover
good length, wide outside off stump, angled bat slash, inside edge, into the pitch, over the bowler and to long-on
slower ball, full outside off stump. Looks to slog across the line, mistimes it. Finds midwicket
low full toss, swinging away from off stump. Kishan falls into the off side, looks to hit this over midwicket into the leg side. Gets it off the toe, and on the bounce to long-off
back of a length at off stump, backs away and lifts it on the up. Finds sweeper cover on the bounce

a strange innings, but he's got 61. He'll have hit more fluent fifties than this in his life. Offcutter, full outside off stump. Looks to dispatch this over the midwicket boundary, gets a top edge that Ojha takes, not too far to his right
full toss outside off stump, pushed feebly to extra cover
gets Raina in the same over. Offcutter, full at leg stump. Goes for the pick up shot to try and clear square leg, but he doesn't get under this enough. Lifts it straight to Dhawan at that boundary
oh dear. Gentle full toss at off stump, walks into the shot. It's a half-hearted pull. Dips on deep midwicket who follows it nicely and snaps this up, inches from the ground
back of a length at off stump, punches off the back foot to sweeper cover
back of a length, googly at off stump, chopped to sweeper cover's right
nearly chips one to extra cover. Good length, drifting in at off stump. He pushes at it with hard hands off the front foot but this lands in front of extra

yikes. How To Lose Your Way 101. Googly, good length. Pitches at off stump. Finch seems to have picked it. That might be the only explanation to why he tried to bludgeon this over the square leg boundary at this point in the innings. Misses the slog sweep, loses his middle stump
yorker at off stump, dug out, straight back to the bowler
good length at middle stump, pushed into the leg side, straight to midwicket
back of a length, angled across off stump, closes the face on this, on the up, pushed to long-on
good length, nips back in sharply from outside off, beats him on the inside edge as he slashes away from the body
good length outside off stump, steps out, pushes on the up to extra cover
good length at middle stump, flicks this to long-on on the up
good length outside off stump, pushed to extra cover on the up
good shot. This is overpitched at outside off stump, he gets to the pitch and hammers this between Faulkner and the umpire
googly, good length outside off stump, leans into it and pushes it past point
googly, back of a length at off stump, makes room and drives to sweeper cover on the up
back of a length at off stump, hangs deep in the crease, tickles this through the open square leg region
good length, slider angled down leg side, and into the pads as he looks to paddle this
good length, slider at middle stump, pushes this into the leg side with soft hands
full toss, angled into the pads, whipped gratefully to the long leg boundary

yorker floors Faulkner as he tries to dig it out. But he manages in the end. Takes some time getting up as Jadeja runs for the singl. Bowler pivots and shies at the non-strikers, can't get a direct hit
back of a length at off stump, dabs it to short third man, teases him at the non-strikers and earns a second via the overthrow to long-on
full ball outside off stump, driven to deep extra cover
bowled him. Good length ball angled in at leg stump, backs away and swings across the line and this one slides through from under the bat. Into leg stump

thanks for coming. Good length ball at middle stump. The kind of regulation stuff you bowl in the nets when there's no batsman at target practice. And it's just as well with the way Sangwan plays this. No clue as he pushes at this well after it has burst through him and into the stumps
yorker at off stump, stays leg side of this, squeezes it out to long-off
full and straight, he was going for, but this drifts down slightly and catches his pads while still moving, in front of leg stump
good length, angled wide across the off stump, and past the wide marker too

that is a strange bit of fielding from Warner. Like a glitch in a video game. Full toss at leg stump, swings across the line, gets it wide of long-on where Warner runs to his left and holds his palms up to his left. The ball went from under
back of a length outside off stump, pushed to sweeper cover on the up
vicious inswinger from outside off stump, beats the inside edge of the bat, beats the outside edge of the stumps
another inswinger, this starts on middle and thuds into the pads. Jadeja refuses the run
back of a length, angled away from Jadeja, who slices this to sweeper cover
inswinger, back of a length. Pitches on off, beats his cross-batted heave, climbs over middle stump. But Jadeja sneaks a bye
offcutter, short and wide outside off stump, makes him check his cut. He can only find sweeper in the end
good length at off stump, looks to slog across the line, it's too quick for him. He can only bunt it back to the bowler
the perfect yorker. Pitches on the crease, takes the inside edge and clatters into the off stump
back of a length at middle stump, flicked off the hips to deep square leg
goes for the helicopter shot, misses by a long way. Once more, big inswinger. This was overpitched, not a yorker. But the movement is too much and he loses leg stump
And another. Munaf looks to clatter it on the up. But it's an inswinger, and he's never been good enough to hit that shot. It pitches on a length and takes leg stump
good length on off, straight. Blocked. Good start from Praveen
drifts on the pads, worked down to fine leg for a run. A little bit of swing, not much
short and wide outside off, some away swing. Carved to backward point
good length on middle and leg, worked away to midwicket with the direction of swing
too straight again. Worked away to the right of short fine leg. Munaf Patel jogs a few metres towards the ball and let it go past. A better fielder may have made Dhawan work hard to complete a single
well down leg again, wide called
126 kph, good length outside off, pushed away to mid-of for a single. A direct hit at the bowler's end, the third umpire is called for. Not sure why. Danny Morrison on air doesn't either.
oh no, don't bowl there to Dhawan. Short and wide outside off, tripe. Dhawan slaps the ball in front of extra cover. Four more easy runs
four more. That's not a bad ball. Shortish outside off, Dhawan stands tall and just guides the ball behind point. It's a lightning outfield, the gap is found. Don't bother
four more. Rackin' 'em up. Back of a length on off, Dhawan flicks away through square leg, always wanted to go leg side. Whatever the length of that
finds the fielder this time. Another terrific stroke. Stands tall and punches a lovely carve to backward point
shortish and wide outside off, sliced to point
a short delivery on off, 132 kph, inside-edged into the pad, towards square leg for a single. Sunrisers well on their way

taken. Dhawan looking to go over midwicket, toe-ends the ball to mid-on. It was a good delivery, a slow offcutter outside off. Dhawan wants to drag a heave over midwicket but can only get the toe of the bat. Carries to Faulkner at mid-on, who dives to his front and takes a simple catch. Credit to Praveen for taking pace off
130 kph, good length and wide outside off, beats Warner's bat. He ain't happy that wasn't wided
another offcutter outside off, Warner watchfully punches a push towards point
on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
that's four extra runs. Full on the pads, henriques flicks to Smith at midwicket who labours towards the ball, lazily bends down and hardly gets a hand on it. Goes away for four. Awful fielding

Praveen's response is excellent. A good length delivery outside off, Henriques sees a slowish delivery coming at him and wants to hit that through the off side, but the ball moves away just a little. Just a little is all you need, especially at this level, to take the edge. Karthik completes the catch. Praveen has undone two batsmen with some wily bowling
good length outside off, pushed to cover, who has a completely unnecessary shy at the bowler's end. Raina fumbles the tough collection while backing up and concedes one
good length delivery on middle and leg, some swerve back in. Defended
fullish delivery around off, dabbed to third man
another slower ball outside off, this is great bowling. Defended to cover
fullish delivery outside off, hit to mid-off. The lines are good
good finish.  Back of a length outside off, played away towards cover. Another dot
a good length delivery outside off, hit back to the bowler. Impeccable lines
a slower ball a couple of stumps outside off, punched to mid-on
too straight this time, flicked to deep square leg
what batting. Just terrific. A low full toss on middle and leg, he knows if it's overpitched there is this option. So he drills a drive straight past mid-off with the fielder squarer than usual
a slower ball outside off, chopped away to extra cover
another slower one down leg, off the pad towards square leg
lovely hit. Coming down the pitch, gets a leg side delivery and flicks away through midwicket for a couple. Raina got a hand on that
120 kph, slower ball outside off, pushed to cover for a single. Good batting.

fullish and wide outside off, played away to point. Oh, wait, it's four. Jadeja picks up and throws at the batsman's end. Kishan somehow totally misses that. It goes through him for another four extras. Shankar's bat was well inside the crease

dropped. Not an easy catch at all. Full and wide outside off. Karthik is closer than usual because of Faulkner's back-of-the-hand slower deliveries. But this is quick pace, a thick outside edge flies to his right, and he can only get a glove on that
fullish and wide, nicely driven wide of cover for a couple. The sweeper cover has to mop up

four more. In the air but in the gap too. In no control of that at all, a slower ball outside off. Warner's through his drive too early, it takes the leading edge and flies between third man and point. A little lucky there Warner
full outside off from Munaf, pushed away to the sweeper cover

full and straight, pushed towards Munaf's left who dives over the ball and concedes another single. Should have stopped that. That's four runs extra conceded by Munaf's fielding. Just not good in this format
on the pads, worked to square leg
good length on off, played to Jadeja at point. Warner is waiting for the call. It comes - 'no, no, no'. It's jadeja on the ball. Good call
fullish and straight, worked to deep square leg
good length outside off, slashed to the sweeper cover
flat outside off, pushed to long-on for a run. Nicely played, using the depth of the crease
shortish outside off, hammered to long-on
full and straight, hit down to long-on
another flat delivery outside off, played towards point
flat outside off, Warner gets across and works the ball to deep midwicket. It's in the gap and they get two
shovelled into the gap at midwicket again, but Smith prevents the second. Good fielding, attacked the ball
great batting. Back of a length outside off, Warner runs at Munaf and calmly guides the ball behind point for four. That's superb field manipulation.
fullish delivery outside off, played away towards cover
picked his spot early but didn't quite execute. It was pace off the ball, a legcutter. So even though Shankar picked the length early, his swat resulted in a couple to deep square leg
shortish outside off, dabbed to third man
on a length down leg, worked to fine leg
that'll go for four. Full and wide from Munaf, Shankar gets down to his cut slightly late. It takes the toe end and races away to Karthik's right. No chance
short on the pad, worked to deep midwicket
flat outside off, nice length, nice trajectory. Pushed to long-on

that was a big edge. Huge moment in the match. Flat and wide outside off, Warner gets a thick outside edge on his cut? Karthik hardly appeals because it's so clear. Umpire Chaudhary says no, at least there was some confidence in his decision. But that's a huge moment. Yep, yep, yep, big edge, big spike on Snicko. Life.
and that's filth. Warner earns himself that stroke by staying back, short and wide. Sliced behind point for four.
nice, loop on off, worked to deep midwicket
the dangers of an inexperienced leggie. He'll bowl bad balls. This one is too short outside off, pulled through midwicket for four. Lovely batting
good length on off, pushed towards the sweeper cover
131 kph, good length on off, pushed away towards the bowler. To his right. Munaf dives and half-stops it, but can't prevent the single anway
full and wide outside off, carved away to backward point.
a slower ball outside off, comes back in. Chopped towards the sweeper cover
a slower ball outside off, another legcutter. Pushed to long-on
full and straight, driven right back to the bowler. Tidy over from Munaf
short and wide outside off, 87 ks. Sliced to the sweeper cover
fullish on off, flicked to deep midwicket for a couple.
well bowled but Warner is too good. A flat quick delivery on off, hammered through midwicket for four. Picked the length early and then his execution is spot on
a googly on leg, clipped to deep midwicket
lovely shot. 83 kph, overpitched from Soni outside off. Shankar gets underneath the length and lifts the ball over the bowler's head. Dead straight. Exceptional
another terrific area to hit the ball into. It's full, it's wide, it's spinning away. Shankar gets underneath the length and lifts his drive over cover. Sublime, thinking batting.
good length on off, worked away towards square leg
full and wide, dabbed to third man. Good batting
full outside off, full face of the bat, driven to long-off for a run
carved down to third man for another single
superb placement. Back of a length outside off, lets the ball come onto him and then carves a cut between third man and point. Opened his bat face so early
pushed wide of long-on for a couple more, another IPL fifty for Davey W. Not his usual explosiveness, but he can bat any way now
flat on leg, worked to deep midwicket
flight outside off, clipped wide of long-on for a couple more. Making batting look easy
short and wide outside off, a flat-batted sweep to deep midwicket
darted in outside off, played away down to third man. Warner says no. Definitely no risk needed
flat on off, carved to point
98 kph, fired in on middle and leg, worked to deep midwicket.
on the pads, clipped to midiwcket
a short delivery on off, Shankar wants to pull but has to drag that pull through square leg. Takes the top edge and races down to the fine leg boundary
full outside off, moves away. Shankar misses a drive. Beaten on the outside edge
lovely shot. Full and wide outside off, Shankar's weight is on the back foot but he carves a slice over point for four
good length on off, the ball seams back in. Played back towards the bowler
on a length outside off, worked past midwicket for a couple. Only a matter of how quickly they want it now
no,maybe it's time. Flat outside off, Warner brings out the big guns. The switch hit. Just enough bat on that to get it fine enough for four to third man
fired in on middle, swatted to deep midwicket
flat and quick on off, pushed away to long-on for a fifty from Shankar. Quality innings under pressure
the dart, round-arm action. Flat and wide, carved to point
drops short outside off, Warner can't get adequately underneath that. His slap finds long-on
95 ks, short and wide again, tapped to short third man. Another single.
full on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
a low full toss at 124 kph, driven to cover. Another dot
on the pads, swivel-flicked on the bounce to deep square leg. His shot selection has stood out
off the pads this time. Full down leg, off the pad down to fine leg for a couple. Karthik dives to his right but can only get a glove on it
runs down and converts a length delivery into a yorker. Can only jam that away towards cover
drifts down leg. Would have been wide had Warner not got bat on that, but he did. A fine tickle past fine leg for four.
on the pads, flicked to deep square leg for a run
full on off, tailing back in. Driven to the sweeper cover for a run
wow. Saw midwicket was more towards square leg so put the ball where midwicket should have been. Flicked his wrists, dragged that stroke into the gap. Awesome
a low full toss on leg, worked to square leg for a couple. Nath dives to his left ans saves two, good stop
is that the first six of the innings? Is that the match? A short delivery outside off, Shankar pulls and finds the gap. The ball bounces a few inches in front of the boundary. Still no six
good finish. A yorker outside off, dug out towards the keeper

86 kph, lovely finish. Flight on middle, Warner gets underneath the length and lifts the ball right over the bowler for four. That means Sunrisers move to the next stage of the IPL, they've qualified for the playoffs. A fist-pump from Warner.
